creditline: Gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky
description: colorful image, with many embellished figures in various vignettes throughout; ladder on L, with a figure at the top, with green skin, and wearing a purple robe, holding up a yellow star; floral shape in C, with yellow center and fourteen petals in blue and pink pigment, grouped in sets of two; large face of a figure in profile, with green skin and large pink lips to the L of floral shape; distorted grotesque face in BC; interior space LRQ, with pink walls with a repeating pattern of tiny, brown horses, and a window revealing a night sky, with moon and starts, and a kneeling figure with green skin, pluming pleated pants, and exposed chest; seated, nude figure in seated position, with a single eye in the C of forehead in URQ
text: Moki Cherry made painting, posters, sculpture and fiber art within a family and extended community dedicated to music and performance. She often made work to accompany music or to be featured as the visual gateway for music, especialy for her partner, the innovative jazz trumpeter Don Cherry. Moki's painting is filled with the forms and imagery that originated in her visions but also coincide with the development of Don Cherry's free improvised music and incorporation of many musical world traditions. The paintings show that same sensibility and integration while being free.
title: [Title unknown]
